chapter.title: The views
chapter.para: This chapter will explain you how to work with views and editors provided by JBDS.

section.title: The Outline View
section.para: To have a way to quickly see an outline of the process use the JBDS Outline view. If it is not visible select Window > Show view > Outline . It is presented as the classical tree view. Also you can use Overview that comes as a scrollable thumbnail.

section.title: The Properties View
section.para: Here, we dwell on the JBDS Properties view.

Notice if it's not visible you can access it by navigating Window > Show view > Properties . The view shows the relevant properties of the selected item. Some of these properties may be directly editable in the properties view. An example of a directly editable property is the name property of the process definition. As you can see in the next figure, the name property of the process definition can be changed to jbay . You can also write a description for this property.

figure.title: The Properties of a Process Definition

section.para: Let's change the name of the first transition to to_auction . We repeat this name change for the second transition and name it to_end .

section.title: Direct Editing
section.para: Besides, some properties can be directly edited in the graphical editor. One example of this is the Name property of nodes. You can edit this directly by selecting the node of which you want to change the name and then click once inside this node. This enables an editor in the node. We change the name of the node to auction .

section.title: The Source View
section.para: Now that we have defined a simple process definition, we can have a look at the xml that is being generated under the covers. To see this xml, click on the source tab of the process definition editor.
This source tab is editable, so if you know your way around in jPDL, you can create or tweak your process definitions directly in the xml source.

section.para: To adjust the deployment settings of the project you should switch to the next tab that opens the Deployment view.
